thread.title: Buying Food At CVS Just Got a Hell Of a Lot Healthier
thread.title_full: Buying Food At CVS Just Got a Hell Of a Lot Healthier

author: Barry K
title: Buying Food At CVS Just Got a Hell Of a Lot Healthier
text:
Privacy Policy | About Us 
“Trans fats can cause an increase in your bad cholesterol (your LDL) and a decrease in your good cholesterol (HDL),” says epidemiologist Mary Ann Honors, Ph.D. 
Granted, if your diet isn’t loaded with processed foods in the first place, you probably won’t notice much of a difference—but if you’re busy and like to pick up on-the-go packaged snacks, the pharmacy chain now offers 600 much healthier options. What’s more, CVS will work to move those options toward the front of the store, reserve a fourth of front checkout space for good-for-you snacks, and start a tagging program to help customers locate hearty healthy, protein-loaded, and organic food options. 
“Our commitment to producing high quality products reinforces that CVS Pharmacy is a leading health destination,” said Judy Sansone, senior vice president of front store business and chief merchant for CVS Health, said in a statement. 
Trans fats aren’t the only ingredients you should be looking out for. Not sure what you should be munching on between meals? Check out the healthiest snacks for men . 
Additional reporting by Christa Sgobba
